assessments.status_rationale: Today’s news includes reporting about a “Warsh pick” for Fed chair, which is evidence of nomination/selection discussions, but the prediction requires U.S. Senate confirmation by 2026-10-31. No confirmation vote/result is evidenced in the provided bullets, so the outcome remains unresolved.
No BLS PPI release data for reference months 2026-01 through 2026-03 is included in today’s bullets. The condition (+0.6% m/m or higher in at least one relevant release) cannot be assessed yet.

While today’s news references a “silver sell-off,” there is no explicit evidence that LBMA spot silver (XAG/USD) experienced a close-to-close move of at least 15% on any trading day. Without the specific move magnitude and definition match, the prediction remains unresolved.

No item in today’s bullets indicates a DOJ announcement of criminal charges against operators of a major residential proxy network disrupted by Google. The deadline is in 2026-06, so this remains open.
There is no evidence in today’s bullets of a CISA advisory/alert explicitly referencing exposed or misconfigured Ollama instances or providing mitigation guidance. The prediction remains unverified.
Today’s bullets do not mention a UN system-wide hiring freeze or cash-conservation measures explicitly attributed to liquidity shortfalls. No confirmation or disconfirmation is present.
No OPEC+ announcement regarding extending production quotas/cuts through 2026-12-31 appears in today’s bullets. This forecast remains open.
No CMS proposed NCD or proposed rule enabling broader Medicare coverage for anti-obesity medications/GLP-1s for obesity treatment is referenced in today’s bullets. The forecast remains unresolved.
There is no mention in today’s bullets of Panama initiating steps to terminate, revoke, or renegotiate CK Hutchison’s Balboa/Cristóbal port concessions. The prediction remains open.
